intro: Psiadia flavocinerea, commonly known as the yellow cinerea psiadia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Psiadia flavocinerea is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions.
